content.description:
Pliny Comments on a Philosopher’s Teaching

Insectaturinsector, -ari = vitupero, -are1 vitia non homines, nec castigatcastigo, -are: to criticize errantes sed
emendatemendo, -are: to improve. Sequaris monentem attentusattentus, -a, -um, adj. = intentus, -a, -um et pendens, et 
persuaderi tibi etiam, cum persuaserit, cupias.
 1:The subject of insectatur is the philosopher.↩
content.question: In line 1, what does vitia mean?

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
